newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street stocks weak at start.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street stocks weak at start.

text.p: Wall Street stocks were down with bonds at the start of trade on Tuesday as a hoped for bounce at the opening failed to materialize.
Investors were waiting for U.S. March NAPM purchasing managers data at 1500 GMT.
The Dow Industrials was off five to 6,579, the Nasdaq Composite down 10 at 1,211 and the S&P Index off two at 756.
The 30-year long bond was off 6/32 to yield 7.12 percent.
